Articles.Content:
Probe Philae rough landed on comet 67P after third try. After first touch harpoon didn't attach to the comet and it has bounced about 1 km away and then later landed after third try.

Interesting is that probe with magnetometer recorded interesting values which are later translated to sound how it would sound for humans if there is no vacuum:

https://soundcloud.com/esaops/a-singing-comet

Edited November 16, 2014 by RussaX
Sounds like a predator for the first bit.
amazing, sun heat probbably causing that sound. Also I am not sure how high that sound is... this is probbably volumed up.

amazing, sun heat probbably causing that sound. Also I am not sure how high that sound is... this is probbably volumed up.

It is not actual sound, those are electromagnetic waves. The frequency has been turned up quite a bit, because humans would not be able to hear otherwise. Still cool though.
Sounds like the planet scanning from Mass Effect.
